org.openide.filesystems

Class LocalFileSystem.Impl

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openide.filesystems.LocalFileSystem.Impl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, AbstractFileSystem.Change, AbstractFileSystem.Info, AbstractFileSystem.List, AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo
    Enclosing class:
    LocalFileSystem

    public static class LocalFileSystem.Impl
extends Object
implements AbstractFileSystem.List, AbstractFileSystem.Info, AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo, AbstractFileSystem.Change
    The implementation class that implements List, Info and Change interfaces and delegates all the methods to appropriate methods of LocalFileSystem.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • children

        public String[] children(String name)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFileSystem.List
        Get a list of children files for a given folder.
        Specified by:
        children in interface AbstractFileSystem.List
        Parameters:
        name - the folder, by name; e.g. top/next/afterthat
        Returns:
        a list of children of the folder, as file.ext (no path) the array can contain null values that will be ignored

      • mimeType

        public String mimeType(String name)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFileSystem.Info
        Get the MIME type of the file. If filesystem has no special support for MIME types then can simply return null. FileSystem can register MIME types for a well-known extensions: FileUtil.setMIMEType(String ext, String mimeType) or together with filesystem supply some resolvers subclassed from MIMEResolver.
        Specified by:
        mimeType in interface AbstractFileSystem.Info
        Parameters:
        name - the file to test
        Returns:
        the MIME type textual representation (e.g. "text/plain") or null if no special support for recognizing MIME is implemented.

      • size

        public long size(String name)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFileSystem.Info
        Get the size of the file.
        Specified by:
        size in interface AbstractFileSystem.Info
        Parameters:
        name - the file to test
        Returns:
        the size of the file in bytes, or zero if the file does not contain data (does not exist or is a folder).

      • lock

        public void lock(String name)
          throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFileSystem.Info
        Lock the file. May do nothing if the underlying storage does not support locking. This does not affect locking using FileLock within NetBeans, however.
        Specified by:
        lock in interface AbstractFileSystem.Info
        Parameters:
        name - name of the file
        Throws:
        IOException - (e.g. FileAlreadyLockedException) if the file is already locked or otherwise cannot be locked

      • markUnimportant

        public void markUnimportant(String name)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFileSystem.Info
        Mark the file as being unimportant. If not called, the file is assumed to be important. Deprecated and new implementations need not do anything.
        Specified by:
        markUnimportant in interface AbstractFileSystem.Info
        Parameters:
        name - the file to mark

      • isSymbolicLink

        public boolean isSymbolicLink(String name)
                       throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo
        Check whether a file represents a symbolic link.
        Specified by:
        isSymbolicLink in interface AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the file.
        Returns:
        True if this file represents a symbolic link, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - If some I/O problem occurs.
        See Also:
        AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo.readSymbolicLink(java.lang.String), AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo.getCanonicalName(java.lang.String)

      • readSymbolicLink

        public String readSymbolicLink(String name)
                        throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo
        Read symbolic link. If the file represents a symbolic link, return its target path. Otherwise the return value is undefined, or IllegalArgumentException can be thrown. This method does not perform any normalization. If the target of symbolic link is defined using relative path, this relative path will be returned.
        Specified by:
        readSymbolicLink in interface AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the file.
        Returns:
        Target of the symbolic link (as absolute or relative path), or some undefined value if name does not represent symbolic link.
        Throws:
        IOException - If some I/O problem occurs.
        See Also:
        AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo.isSymbolicLink(java.lang.String)

      • getCanonicalName

        public String getCanonicalName(String name)
                        throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo
        Get canonical file name (resolve all symbolic links).
        Specified by:
        getCanonicalName in interface AbstractFileSystem.SymlinkInfo
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the file.
        Returns:
        Path that represents the same file as name and where all symbolic links are resolved.
        Throws:
        IOException - If some I/O problem occurs.
